text:
Hello again, Smarth.

Just to let you know I'm on annual leave next week (though I can't of course go anywhere) so I won't be logged on here. Back on Monday 20th April though.

Right, let's dive into these questions then.  Yes, I love writing, it's the thing that makes me happiest regardless of the money, or lack of it.

The short film was for a scheme called It's my Shout, each year they look for directors, writers, crew and actors with limited experience to take part. My script was picked out of the submissions.
I had to do some rewriting based on notes from the producer and director, but then left them to make the film. Again, no pay, but valuable experience. I studied screenwriting after I did my degree but drifted into comics. Now that I have 10 years tv/film experience I am starting to use my contacts to get back into writing for the screen.

I set up a small virtual studio called Orang Utan Comics - basically a website and then spoke to artists and persuaded them to draw my comics, then sold them at conventions, online and in my local comic shop. So a small business that didn't make money, but covered all its costs.

Shall we move into some specific start your own business questions next? I have run two virtual studios, been MD at a radio station and a vfx studio so despite not setting up my own company, have set up new ventures and run businesses for others.

Thanks
Pete
